TopicTitle: War Thunder - Screenshots and Discussion thread!

Articles.Content: I enjoy it a lot its 6 12.7mm machine might as well be cannons. As long as you don't turn fight and dive away if the engagement doesn't go your way it is amazing.

[quote name='gag09']The a-36 is a better fighter then it is an attacker.[/QUOTE]
I would say the same for the A-20. I gave up using it for killing tanks and now use it mostly as a bomber hunter. There aren't many things on this earth more exhilarating than shooting down a B-25 with unguided rockets. Even if you can't kill bombers, the A-20 carries enough rockets to bring a base down to half health in one pass.

Well, I finally researched the Ju 87 D-3. Yay!

..It means that it's time to replace..

My aging B-2.

I need to make a commemoration.

[I]*Ahem*[/I]

[I]Oh, my little Stuka,

How will I miss your trumpets roar,
As you speed down more and more.
Diving through the sky,
With your beauty, oh my.
A magnificent dive bomber you are,
Flying through the horrors of war.


[/I][img]http://i.imgur.com/oSL6ksx.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/vdDsQDe.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/3r3A80Q.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/SW3N4gl.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/TR0Fv1U.jpg[/img]
I will miss you, [I]M[/I][I]ein kleines Flugzeug.[/I]

I got the D-3 the other day as well. Besides the extra machine gun in the turret, funky cockpit canopy, and unfortunate lack of sirens, I can't really tell a difference.

The extra MG doesn't even have that much effect in combat, the rear turret still sucks.

Ladies and Gentlemen, may I present the Beaufort, the finest example of British engineering. This thing can take a beating, I feel lied to by the guy who told me British bombers sucked!
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/PvMkC9U.jpg[/IMG]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/ZDLEfy9.jpg[/IMG]
I survived both of these situations

[quote name='pTrevTrevs']Ladies and Gentlemen, may I present the Beaufort, the finest example of British engineering. This thing can take a beating, I feel lied to by the guy who told me British bombers sucked!
[URL]http://i.imgur.com/PvMkC9U.jpg[/URL]
[URL]http://i.imgur.com/ZDLEfy9.jpg[/URL]
I survived both of these situations[/QUOTE]


Oh, yes.. the Beaufighter..

It was the bomber that I didn't like because it didn't have armament -- Back when i was still a WT noob. Nevertheless, I used it for a long, long time, until I got the Wellingtons.

Is it just me, or do I post here more often than anyone else?

Whatever, here's a summary of my War Thunder experience today.

Got the F6F
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/mo18b1p.jpg[/IMG]

I also tried the Battle of Guam dynamic campaign. Apparently the thing that lets you clip through other planes when close enough to the ground doesn't work here, I immediately crashed.
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/fcVC5Ki.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]http://abload.de/img/shot2015.11.2322.33.299pjn.jpg[/IMG] So apparently the P 47 is the best jet fighter...
Even the f-86 isn't immune to this beast.[IMG]http://abload.de/img/shot2015.11.2323.20.2xuzkp.jpg[/IMG] Edited November 24, 2015 by gag09

[quote name='gag09']So apparently the P 47 is the best jet fighter...[/QUOTE]

The P-47 is pretty able to do anything, so it wont surprise me (Its also undertiered)...

[video=youtube;dx6ICs897Eo]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dx6ICs897Eo[/video]

Well, I just did a thing.
They patched the ability to ROFL stop sabres with the P-47.

So I finally got the Bf 109 F-1.

 

God, looks beautiful and gorgeous as hell.
I need to get back into War Thunder...after I get done being grounded, that is...

yeah, been busy with WOWS and being grounded

Got the I-153M, the I-15bis, the I-16, the SB-2M and a Swordfish all in one day. I also have another vid that I'll post up soon

 

Also when can we do a squadron battle?

Anyone who still plays?
I still play, but my computer has been in the shop lately, and I also bought Medieval II: Total War right before it broke, so that's been taking up most of my time.
I still play but I've been away for the week
..There is nothing more satisfying than ramming an aircraft in Test Flights.

On 16 December 2015 at 9:55 PM, pTrevTrevs said:

Wait, that's a test flight? How did you get the bomber formation in?

In the Test Flight menu, there should be a button that says "Mission Editor" and.. The rest should be *pretty* self-explanatory.

Ah, WT, the reason behind my mission report thread not having been updated in weeks. I'll have some time this weekend if anyone wants to squad up

Current mount of choice: the trusty T-50.
